alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Clinton and central Jackson Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from near Zwingle to Sabula. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Sabula, Miles, Andrew, Springbrook, Spragueville, Fulton, Green Island, Van Buren, Otter Creek, South Gary Owen, Garry Owen, Teeds Grove, Cottonville, Reeceville, Crab Town, South Sabula Lake Park and Camp Miss-Elk-Ton. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have fallen and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain are possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement.
